name: Mantra Geraldton

reviews.title: Modern and convenient
reviews.text: This is a pleasant modern development, and our apartment came very well-equipped. The common area is a little characterless, although there's a nice sized pool with plenty of shade. Part of a new waterfront development, so the area may become more exciting with time - that said it is still only a short and very pleasant walk into town.
Stayed here for 3 nights in a 3 bedroom apartment.
reviews.title: Probably best choice in Geraldton

reviews.text: Parts of this hotel are under construction. New development occuring on the waterfront. Reception is in a temporary building.
reviews.title: I didnt feel safe there

reviews.text: Checkin was polite and efficient, checkout not as good.
reviews.title: Cyclone Iggy

reviews.text: The rooms are quite nice inside but minimal interesting view to speak of. Our room looked over a large dirt block but it did look up to the HMAS Sydney Memorial on the hill. Rooms are relatively clean but always feel there is a fine red dust over everything.
reviews.title: Well located, functional & clean

reviews.text: Stayed here over New Year with a friend and her two sons. Well appointed 2 bedroom apartment with kitchen. Both rooms en suite, one had a bath, the other had the washing maching in it! Slightly odd but fine. Very clean but I wouldn't say luxury accomodation. Nice pool though not particularly warm. Very near the foreshore in Geraldton which has been recently developed.
reviews.title: Comfortable, spacious, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very good but if you get a room along the main road the noise is extreme. Trucks, loud cars and bikes at all hours along the road right outside. Never one good nights sleep in a month of the stay. Should of been built with double glazed windows.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but the noise

reviews.text: Undercover, secure parking, a bit tight but safe. Good location, can leave the car and it's a six minute walk to town centre or about 10 minutes to the shopping centre.
reviews.title: Fantastic family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment. 3rd bedroom on mezzanine floor. Heaps of room. Very clean. Lots of space. Fantastic pool, spa and BBQ areas.
reviews.title: Really comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights on our way to Perth from Monkey Mia.. the apartment had everything we could wish for (apart from any kind of view as it looks out on to the road). Our apartment was clean and very convenient to all sights and the harbour. Excellent value for money.
reviews.title: WOW - Service second to none

reviews.text: I stayed here overnight on business. Great rooms, nice pool, good location. Bed was very comfortable and there is plenty of space. Only complaint was my room (6) was next to the road and the early morning traffic was a bit noisy.
reviews.title: Good but a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have only one reservation about this accommodation. You would think that a place on Foreshore Drive, next to the Marina, and with an ad showing a family group making sand castles, would surely have a sea view. Alas, no! (Perhaps the smallest glimpse from the upstairs apartments. And with new building underway, the situation may change in the future.) But as for the apartment, this place has every conceivable mod-con. Kitchen, dining/living, king size bed, en suite with spa and separate shower, and everything ultra modern. Cars are parked under cover in a locked yard. Price wise it is at the top end of the market, but it does not disappoint. Chloe on Reception was very friendly and helpful. The living room lamp wasn't working, but I’m sure it would have been fixed if I'd mentioned it. The apartments are very close to the beach, and easy walking distance to two shopping centres. A great place to stay.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: All of WA is expensive and this place is no exception, however unlike some expesnive WA options this place was nice.
reviews.title: Very nice but pricey

reviews.text: Well sized, equipped and decorated and the girls on reception were friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for families

reviews.text: Beds were comfortable and cleanliness was above par.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay again

reviews.text: From the web site this is a wonderful place, however looks can be deceiving. I agree with the comments from other travellers that the beds are comfortable. However the TV supplied in the bedrooms should come with a telescope handy. I did not know TVs that small and antiquated were still available. The shower has taps that need way too many turns to regulate the water temperature, with only a moderate water flow. The lounge furniture is way too uncomfortable for extended sitting and the kitckenette is poky. The gated car park is also a trap for the unwary, with many roof support pillars showing the damage marks of cars hitting them while exiting. For the price, I expected a lot more. Not a fan.
reviews.title: A little disappointing really

reviews.text: I must say I absolutely love this place. For someone who practically lives out of hotels (being 4-5 days week) I have high expectations. I always choose apartment style hotels as being in them so often it's to expensive to be ordering room service 5 days a week.
reviews.title: I love this place :) and when visiting Geraldton never bother to look at the rates of other hotels.

reviews.text: The thing I love about this place the most is the amazing service. The staff always make me feel welcome, weather it be reception, the cleaners or the maintenance guy. When booking calling the loverly office ladies is my first and only step. They are a home away from home :) I love them to bits.
reviews.title: Not the standard expected from Mantra
Excellent location & spacious
reviews.text: It doesn't have a restaurant or bar. But really most hotels room service is really bad so to me it's not a bit deal. If I want dinner cooked for me I will head out and see what the town has to offer.

I have seen someone say that it doesn't compare to other Mantra's. They can't have stayed at very many. Quite a few don't have restaurants and bars as they are self contained. It's of a higher standard then Mantra Perth, and of Mantra Hobart. Yes the stove is a little bit older then the one in Geraldton, and the furniture is whicker, but apart from the rooms are of the same standard. I prefer the softer Bed over hard and find the bed in Geraldton is alot more to my liking :) Everyone is different so it's personal preference.
reviews.title: The Mantra

description: Geraldton is located on the mid-west coast of Western Australia and is the main commercial hub of the growing mid-west. Centrally located on Champion Bay Marina, Mantra Geraldton is within a short walk of Geraldton’s Central Business District and the popular local Maritime Museum. Offering spacious One, Two and Three Bedroom Apartments all include a fully-equipped kitchen, laundry, spacious lounge and dining areas. Internet access and ISD/STD direct dial phones are available in-room along with a host of amenities to make your stay more comfortable. All apartments include a king size bed, ensuite with spa, TV and DVD in living area and TV and VCR in all bedrooms. Two and Three Bedroom Apartments have the convenience of two bathrooms, and all apartments feature either a private courtyard or balcony. Facilities include a heated indoor/outdoor pool and the convenience of being within close proximity of Geraldton’s premier shopping and dining precincts. Well-known as an excellent spot for windsurfing and kite boarding, it is also one of the largest commercial fishing catchment areas in the region. Mantra Geraldton offers guests comfortable facilities at an affordable price in a central Geraldton location.
